page.title: 18ATTITUDES TO LIVING
page.content: Attitudes to living in this area are based very much on the individual. With a high percentage of self employment or employment in small concerns (farms) there is a tendency to be isolationist. The fact of many retired people also encourages the attitude of 'my home is my castle'. There are occasional (mainly summer) efforts to engender close community spirit but generally people get on with their own lives with the consequence that there is not much local social mixing. Traditional homes for local attitudes - the local pub (Boot Inn) and churches have been notably low in attendance in recent years. Local attitudes are variable in relation to the church - traditionalists v modernists. Flyford clergymen have found pockets of resistance to their efforts.
